column5: Hi folks! I have just moved into my new to me house, it has an in-ground pool and I'm having some concerns about the pump/filter system. If anyone out there has some knowledge in this area, I'd sure appreciate a PM! Thanks in advance! HH
I don't have one, but Steve does and my aunt did for 20+ years...what do you need to know?  Maureen
Well I think I'd better come over and jump in and test the chlorine levels etc.  Sorry, can't help Joe.  Joey
Gimmie a shout Joe, we'll get you sorted out. I took care of our family pool for 20 of my 30 years.   Gerritt.
just swim in a lake.better yet turn your pool into a bass pond.

Send me a PM with your phone number if you want I will give you a call.  I worked for a pool company from the age of 16 to 25 all through high school and university.  I have an inground now and have done everything from installing them, painting them, cleaning them etc....  Nothing like being the pool boy growing up and servicing all those Toronto Condos.   Cheers
Thanks to all who responded, here and through PM's! I think I've got 'er solved at this point, but I do reserve the right to come back and beg for help! LOL HH
